result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds  under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining  balance upon release to Extended superivsion shall be due immediately. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alchol.  No use or pssession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, ammunition or holster.
No possession of any alcohol.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivery or distribution.
No more than $150.00 cash (coins or bills) at one time.
Comply with paying DOC supervision fees.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

Court advises the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary Leevaice Bryant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript commencing 10/24/2014 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF1625 (44 Pages).

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F. Klimetz.  Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional Statements made by: Ricky B.
AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 27 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, ammunition or holster.
- No possession of any alcohol. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivery, or distribution. 
- No more than $150.00 cash (coins or bills) at one time.
- Maintain full time work. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with paying Department of Correction Supervision fees. 
- DNA sample, if not already provided. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Justice Point Report - Discharge Summary - received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending Sentencing.

Attorney Frederick F. Klimetz in court, defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl for Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court due to the Justice Point Status Update received 9-26-2014. For the reasons placed on the record the Court Orders the Defendant Remanded and withholds decision on any signature bond or cash bond. 
Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 10-24-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
Justice Point Status Update dated September 25, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F. Klimetz.  Patricia I. Daugherty for Karyn Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is scheduled for Sentencing Hearing. Due to the reasons placed on the record Court orders the case adjourned for Sentencing on 10-24-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated September 4, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F. Klimetz.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case was set for Final Pretrial. 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court orders the Jury Trial scheduled for 8/20/2014, vacated. 
Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing 9/5/2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Posession With Intent to Deliver Cocaine (<=5G), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41(1m)(cm)1r , a Class F Felony. 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered the Penalty Enhancer dismissed and read in to the case for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 15, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advised effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, Room 313 safety building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed with court.
Due to death in family Defense will not be able to appear tomorrow afternoon for the Scheduling Conference.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case consolidated with 14CF1625.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court grants State's motion for consolidation with 14CF1625.  Parties to investigate local rule for which court shall hear these matters.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-30-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense requests an adjournment, defendant wants time to retain private counsel.  Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE in Branch PE.  Court official was changed due to the pending charges in Branch 44.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

14RM020613  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-14-14

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
